channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024040070
item.description:
Report E-2024040070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: COWPENS
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drum was unloaded from the box trailer for in transit storage. When drum was staged for storage, a leak was noticed. After further inspection, there was a pinhole leak near the bottom chime of the drum. Once the leak was noticed, the drum was set on a spill pallet and then the drum was placed into an overpack drum. No evidence of leaks were found in the box trailer.

item.title: Report X-2024031436
item.description:
Report X-2024031436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 22 during the AM sort a package was found leaking. the package was marked as UN1789, HYDROCHLORIC ACID, 8, III. two plastic bottles were inside and one of them was leaking due to the cap being loose. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024030583
item.description:
Report E-2024030583

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 19, 2024, one (!) 50-pound box of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and loading dock floor. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.
